title: Sulli autopsy rules out murder after K-pop star found dead at home
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Preliminary autopsy results into the death of K-pop star Sulli have been released.

The singer and actress - real name Choi Jin-ri - was found dead at the age of 25 on October 14 at her home in Seongnam, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea.

A spokesperson from from Seongnam Sujeong Police has since confirmed that there are no suspicions of homicide in her death.

In a statement they said: "No suspicions of homicide, such as external forces or pressure, were discovered as a result of the preliminary autopsy.’

Results from drug and toxicology reports have yet to be published.

(Image: Visual China Group via Getty Ima)

Police previously said they suspected Sulli's death could be suicide.

A police spokesperson said: "It seems that Choi was living alone at the house.

"It looks like she ended her life but we will investigate, open to all possibilities."

(Image: WireImage)

Sulli's body had been found by her manager at around 3.21pm local time on Monday 14 October.

He visited the house after being unable to reach the star after their last phone call at 6.30pm on Suday.

Sulli was a member of K-pop band f(x) but took a hiatus in 2014 after extreme online abuse.

(Image: WireImage)

Her break was only supposed to last for a year, but she later decided to quit the group and pursue a career in acting instead.

She rose to fame at the age of 11, playing Princess Seonhwa of Silla in the SBS drama Ballad of Seodong.

She also starred in films like Fashion King and I AM and TV shows like Hotel del Luna and To the Beautiful You.

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Her band f(x) enjoyed success with songs like Pinocchio (Danger), Electric Shock and Hot Summer.

Earlier this year, the star has surprised her fans by releasing new music with single Goblin.

She also returned to the stage to perform at SM Town Theatre in Seoul in June.

description: The 25-year-old singer, real name Choi Jin-ri, was found dead at home earlier this month
authors: Visual China Group Via Getty Ima
